title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Corinthians chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Corinthians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:1, what did Paul determine about coming again to the Corinthians?
options: He would not come again to them in heaviness
He would come with great joy
He would send a letter instead
questions.correctAnswer: He would not come again to them in heaviness
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:1 states that Paul determined not to come again to them in heaviness.

questions.question: Who does Paul say makes him glad if he makes the Corinthians sorry, according to 2 Corinthians 2:2?
options: The same which is made sorry by him
questions.correctAnswer: The same which is made sorry by him
questions.explanation: Paul says only the same person who is made sorry by him can make him glad, as per 2 Corinthians 2:2.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 2:4, what reason does Paul give for writing to the Corinthians with many tears?
options: So they might know the love he has more abundantly
questions.correctAnswer: So they might know the love he has more abundantly
questions.explanation: Paul wrote with many tears not to grieve them but so that they might know his abundant love (2 Corinthians 2:4).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:6, what is sufficient punishment for the man who caused grief?
questions.correctAnswer: The punishment inflicted by many
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that the punishment inflicted by many is sufficient for such a man.

questions.question: What does Paul urge the Corinthians to do toward the person who caused grief, in 2 Corinthians 2:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Forgive him and comfort him
questions.explanation: Paul instructs the Corinthians to forgive and comfort the person to prevent excessive sorrow (2 Corinthians 2:7).

questions.question: Where did Paul go after not finding Titus, according to 2 Corinthians 2:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Into Macedonia
questions.explanation: After not finding Titus, Paul left Troas and went into Macedonia (2 Corinthians 2:13).

questions.question: What does Paul say God always causes us to do, in 2 Corinthians 2:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Triumph in Christ
questions.explanation: Paul thanks God who always causes us to triumph in Christ (2 Corinthians 2:14).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:15, what are we unto God in them that are saved and in them that perish?
questions.correctAnswer: A sweet savour of Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 15 describes believers as a sweet savour of Christ to both the saved and the perishing.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 2:16, what is the savour of death unto death contrasted with?
options: The savour of life unto life
questions.correctAnswer: The savour of life unto life
questions.explanation: Verse 16 contrasts the savour of death unto death with the savour of life unto life.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:17, how does Paul describe the way he and his companions speak?
options: In sincerity, as of God, in Christ
questions.correctAnswer: In sincerity, as of God, in Christ
questions.explanation: Paul states that they speak with sincerity, as from God, in Christ (2 Corinthians 2:17).

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 2:10, Paul says he forgives for the sake of the Corinthians in the person of Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 10 confirms Paul forgives for the Corinthians' sake in the person of Christ.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 2:11, Paul is ignorant of Satan's devices.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul says we are not ignorant of Satan's devices (2 Corinthians 2:11).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 2:12, a door was opened to Paul of the Lord to preach Christ's gospel in Troas.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states a door was opened unto Paul of the Lord to preach in Troas.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Corinthians 2:8: 'Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your ______ toward him.'
questions.correctAnswer: love
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:8 asks to confirm your love toward him.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Corinthians 2:3: '...having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: you all
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states Paul's joy is the joy of you all.

medium.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer has caused grief in the church and feels overwhelmed with sorrow. Based on 2 Corinthians 2, what biblical advice would you share about how the church should respond?
options: The church should forgive and comfort him to prevent excessive sorrow
The church should continue to punish him severely without forgiveness
The church should ignore him so he learns his lesson alone
The church should publicly shame him to deter others
questions.correctAnswer: The church should forgive and comfort him to prevent excessive sorrow
questions.explanation: In 2 Corinthians 2:6-8, Paul instructs that the punishment is sufficient and urges the church to forgive and comfort the person so he is not overwhelmed by sorrow. This shows the importance of forgiveness and restoration in church discipline.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 2 teach us about the importance of forgiveness within the Christian community?
options: Forgiveness is essential and should be extended to others as Christ forgave us
Forgiveness is optional depending on the offense
Forgiveness should be given only after a long period of punishment
Forgiveness should be withheld to maintain discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Forgiveness is essential and should be extended to others as Christ forgave us
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:10 emphasizes that Paul forgives for the sake of the community, forgiving in the person of Christ, highlighting the necessity of forgiveness reflecting Christ's example.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with doubt about Satan's influence in their life. What does 2 Corinthians 2 teach about being aware of spiritual opposition?
options: We must not be ignorant of Satan’s devices and be vigilant
Satan has no influence over believers
We should confront Satan without caution
Spiritual opposition is a myth and should be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: We must not be ignorant of Satan’s devices and be vigilant
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:11 warns believers to be aware of Satan’s schemes so he does not gain advantage, teaching vigilance in spiritual warfare.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the way God causes believers to triumph, and what is the practical application for perseverance?
options: God always causes us to triumph in Christ, demonstrating the power of faith in trials
Believers triumph by their own strength and wisdom
Triumph is only for those without suffering
questions.correctAnswer: God always causes us to triumph in Christ, demonstrating the power of faith in trials
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:14 states God causes believers to triumph in Christ, showing that faith leads to victory even in trials, encouraging perseverance.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 2 teach about the role of believers as a 'sweet savour' to God in evangelism?
options: Believers are a sweet savour of Christ to both the saved and the lost, impacting all people
Believers should only focus on those already saved
Evangelism is optional and depends on circumstances
Believers should avoid sharing the gospel with those who reject it
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are a sweet savour of Christ to both the saved and the lost, impacting all people
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:15-16 explains that believers carry the fragrance of Christ, resulting in life to some and death to others, underscoring the universal impact of the gospel.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2, how should a believer respond when feeling sorrow over a fellow Christian’s sin?
options: Sorrow should lead to love and forgiveness, not despair
Sorrow should lead to rejection and punishment
Sorrow should be kept private and not shared
Sorrow means the relationship is broken permanently
questions.correctAnswer: Sorrow should lead to love and forgiveness, not despair
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:4 and 2:7 show that Paul's sorrow was motivated by love, and he encourages forgiveness to restore relationships, teaching us to respond with grace.

questions.question: What can we learn from Paul’s decision not to come in heaviness again to the Corinthians about Christian leadership and pastoral care?
options: Leaders should seek to encourage and bring joy rather than sorrow
Leaders should avoid addressing issues altogether
Leaders must always be strict and harsh
Leaders should ignore the feelings of the congregation
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should seek to encourage and bring joy rather than sorrow
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:1 shows Paul’s resolve to come with joy and not heaviness, modeling pastoral care that prioritizes encouragement and restoration.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 2, Paul wrote with many tears to make the believers feel grieved and guilty.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:4 clarifies Paul’s tears were not to make the believers grieved but to reveal his abundant love for them.

questions.question: True or False: Paul wrote to the Corinthians to test whether they were obedient in all things.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:9 explicitly states Paul wrote to know the proof of their obedience, emphasizing the importance of faithfulness.

questions.question: When Paul found no rest in his spirit because he did not find Titus, what practical lesson about Christian fellowship and support can we learn?
options: Believers benefit from the support and presence of fellow Christians in ministry
Ministry should be done independently without relying on others
Disappointment in ministry is a sign of weak faith
It is better to avoid asking about fellow believers
questions.correctAnswer: Believers benefit from the support and presence of fellow Christians in ministry
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:13 shows Paul’s unrest when Titus was not found, highlighting the importance of Christian fellowship and mutual encouragement in ministry.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 2, Paul contrasts his ministry with others who corrupt the word of God. What does this teach about integrity in Christian service?
options: Christian service should be sincere and faithful to God's truth
It is acceptable to alter God's word for popularity
Integrity is optional in ministry as long as results are good
Deception is an effective way to grow the church
questions.correctAnswer: Christian service should be sincere and faithful to God's truth
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:17 states Paul and his companions speak with sincerity in Christ, teaching the necessity of integrity and faithfulness in ministry.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 2 illustrate the role of love in church discipline and restoration?
options: Love motivates correction, forgiveness, and comfort for restoration
Love means avoiding discipline to keep peace
Love requires strict punishment without forgiveness
Love is secondary to maintaining order at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Love motivates correction, forgiveness, and comfort for restoration
questions.explanation: Throughout 2 Corinthians 2 (especially verses 4, 7, and 8), Paul demonstrates that love underlies his correction and calls for forgiveness and comfort, emphasizing restoration.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul wrote to the Corinthians out of much ______ and anguish of heart, with many tears.
questions.correctAnswer: affliction
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:4 states Paul wrote out of much affliction and anguish of heart, revealing the depth of his concern and love for the believers.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 2 guide believers in dealing with temptation and spiritual warfare?
options: By being aware of Satan’s devices and standing firm in Christ
By ignoring temptation and hoping it passes
By confronting Satan without support from God
By avoiding fellowship with other believers
questions.correctAnswer: By being aware of Satan’s devices and standing firm in Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:11 warns believers to be aware of Satan’s schemes, implying the need for vigilance and reliance on Christ to resist temptation.

questions.question: What does Paul’s experience in Troas teach us about trusting God’s timing and guidance in ministry?
options: God opens doors for ministry, but we must trust His timing even when plans change
We should only proceed when everything feels perfect
Ministry success depends solely on human effort
We should never leave a place until all is resolved
questions.correctAnswer: God opens doors for ministry, but we must trust His timing even when plans change
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:12-13 shows Paul had a door opened to preach but had no rest until he found Titus, leading him to Macedonia, teaching trust in God’s leading despite delays.

hard.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Corinthians Chapter 2.

questions.question: What was Paul's determined purpose regarding his visit to the Corinthians as expressed in 2 Corinthians 2:1?
options: Not to come again to them in heaviness
To confront them harshly about their sins
To bring new teachings from the Lord
To collect offerings for the Jerusalem church
questions.correctAnswer: Not to come again to them in heaviness
questions.explanation: Paul states in 2 Corinthians 2:1 that he resolved not to come to the Corinthians again with sorrow or heaviness, indicating his intent to avoid causing distress.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 2:4, Paul mentions writing with many tears. What is the primary reason he gave for this emotional writing?
options: So they might know his abundant love
To show his authority as an apostle
To prepare them for a second letter
questions.correctAnswer: So they might know his abundant love
questions.explanation: Paul explains in 2 Corinthians 2:4 that his tears and affliction were not meant to cause grief but to reveal the abundance of his love for them.

questions.question: What is the significance of the punishment mentioned in 2 Corinthians 2:6?
options: It was sufficient as it was inflicted by many
It was a formal excommunication by the church
It was a physical punishment ordered by Roman authorities
It was a symbolic ritual cleansing
questions.correctAnswer: It was sufficient as it was inflicted by many
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that the punishment inflicted by many was sufficient for the man who caused grief, indicating communal discipline rather than additional penalty by Paul.

questions.question: How does Paul instruct the Corinthians to treat the person who caused grief, according to 2 Corinthians 2:7?
options: They ought rather to forgive and comfort him
They should expel him from the community
They should ignore him until he repents
questions.correctAnswer: They ought rather to forgive and comfort him
questions.explanation: Paul advises in 2 Corinthians 2:7 that instead of further punishment, the Corinthians should forgive and comfort the person to prevent overwhelming sorrow.

questions.question: What was one of Paul's purposes in writing to the Corinthians, as he indicates in 2 Corinthians 2:9?
options: To test if they are obedient in all things
To ask for financial support for his mission
questions.correctAnswer: To test if they are obedient in all things
questions.explanation: Verse 9 reveals Paul’s intention to know the proof of their obedience, which shows his pastoral concern and the testing of their faithfulness.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:10, on whose behalf does Paul forgive offenses?
options: On the authority of the Corinthian church
questions.correctAnswer: On the person of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul states in 2 Corinthians 2:10 that his forgiveness is done for the sake of the Corinthians in the person of Christ, emphasizing Christ's mediatorial role.

questions.question: What is the spiritual danger Paul warns against in 2 Corinthians 2:11?
options: Satan gaining an advantage through ignorance of his devices
questions.correctAnswer: Satan gaining an advantage through ignorance of his devices
questions.explanation: Verse 11 warns the Corinthians not to be ignorant of Satan’s schemes, lest he gains an advantage over them, highlighting spiritual warfare.

questions.question: What does Paul say God always causes us to do in Christ, according to 2 Corinthians 2:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Triumph
questions.explanation: In 2 Corinthians 2:14, Paul expresses gratitude to God who always leads believers to triumph in Christ, a theme of victory in the New Testament.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 2:15, Paul uses the metaphor of a 'sweet savour.' How is this savour perceived by those who are saved and those who perish?
options: Sweet savour to the saved and savour of death to the perishing
Sweet savour to both the saved and the perishing
Bitter savour to the saved and sweet to the perishing
questions.correctAnswer: Sweet savour to the saved and savour of death to the perishing
questions.explanation: Paul explains in verse 15 that believers are a sweet savour of Christ to God, but this is received differently by those saved and those perishing.

questions.question: The phrase 'Lest Satan should get an advantage of us' in 2 Corinthians 2:11 highlights what theme commonly found in the New Testament?
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual warfare and vigilance
questions.explanation: This verse reflects the New Testament theme of spiritual warfare, urging believers to be aware of the enemy’s schemes.

questions.question: What emotional state does Paul mention as his motivation for writing to the Corinthians in 2 Corinthians 2:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Affliction and anguish of heart
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly states in verse 4 that he wrote out of much affliction and anguish of heart, showing the depth of his pastoral concern.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In 2 Corinthians 2:17, Paul contrasts his ministry with others who 'corrupt the word of God' by emphasizing _____ and speaking 'in Christ.'
questions.correctAnswer: sincerity
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts his sincere ministry of the word of God with those who corrupt it, as stated in 2 Corinthians 2:17.

questions.question: When Paul came to Troas as recorded in 2 Corinthians 2:12, what circumstance troubled his spirit?
options: He was rejected by the local believers
He fell ill and could not preach
questions.correctAnswer: He did not find Titus
questions.explanation: Verse 13 tells us Paul had no rest because he did not find Titus, indicating the importance of Titus for Paul's mission and encouragement.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 2:16, the message of Christ is perceived as a 'savour of life unto life' to those who perish.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 2:16 states that to those who perish, the message is a 'savour of death unto death,' not life.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 2:8, Paul appeals to the Corinthians to confirm their love toward the one who caused grief.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly beseeches the Corinthians in verse 8 to reaffirm their love toward the offender, demonstrating restoration and forgiveness.

theological.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was Paul's initial determination regarding his visit to the Corinthians?
options: He would not come again to them in heaviness
He would come with stern rebuke
He would delay his visit indefinitely
He would come with joy and celebration
questions.correctAnswer: He would not come again to them in heaviness
questions.explanation: Paul states in 2 Corinthians 2:1 that he resolved not to visit them with sorrow, reflecting a pastoral concern consistent with Scripture such as Proverbs 15:30, Psalm 126:5, Romans 12:15, and Galatians 6:2, which emphasize joy and comfort in relationships among believers.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:4, why did Paul write to the Corinthians with many tears?
options: So that they might know the love he has more abundantly for them
To make them feel guilty and grieved
To assert his authority over them
questions.correctAnswer: So that they might know the love he has more abundantly for them
questions.explanation: Verse 4 reveals Paul's pastoral motivation is love, not grief. This aligns with biblical themes of love in 1 Corinthians 13:1-3, John 13:34, Romans 5:8, and 1 John 4:9-10.

questions.question: What does Paul instruct the Corinthians to do toward the person who caused grief, according to 2 Corinthians 2:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Forgive and comfort him
questions.explanation: Paul encourages forgiveness and comfort to prevent overwhelming sorrow, showing the restorative nature of church discipline consistent with Matthew 18:21-22, Ephesians 4:32, Colossians 3:13, and Luke 17:3-4.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 2:10, Paul speaks of forgiving on whose behalf?
options: In the name of the apostles
In the authority of the church elders
questions.correctAnswer: In the person of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul states forgiveness is exercised in Christ's person, reflecting the centrality of Christ’s mediation (Hebrews 7:25, 1 Timothy 2:5, Colossians 1:20, and Ephesians 1:7).

questions.question: What is the reason Paul gives for being cautious about Satan gaining an advantage over the believers?
options: Because we are not ignorant of his devices
Because Satan is stronger than us
questions.correctAnswer: Because we are not ignorant of his devices
questions.explanation: Paul warns against Satan’s cunning, emphasizing spiritual vigilance (2 Corinthians 2:11), which parallels teachings in Ephesians 6:11-12, 1 Peter 5:8, James 4:7, and 1 John 4:4.

questions.question: Which city did Paul visit where he found an open door to preach the gospel?
questions.correctAnswer: Troas
questions.explanation: Paul mentions Troas as a place where the Lord opened a door for the gospel (2 Corinthians 2:12), illustrating divine providence in mission (Acts 16:8-10, Colossians 4:3, 1 Corinthians 16:8, and Revelation 3:8).

questions.question: What caused Paul to have no rest in his spirit when he was in Troas?
options: He did not find Titus his brother
questions.correctAnswer: He did not find Titus his brother
questions.explanation: Paul’s unrest was due to not finding Titus (2 Corinthians 2:13), showing the importance of fellowship and support in ministry, consistent with Philippians 2:19-30, Acts 15:36-41, Romans 16:21, and Philemon 1:23.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:14, what does God do through believers in Christ?
options: Causes them to triumph and manifests the savour of His knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Causes them to triumph and manifests the savour of His knowledge
questions.explanation: Paul praises God for victory through Christ and the fragrance of the gospel conveyed by believers, in line with Romans 8:37, 2 Corinthians 4:15, Philippians 1:6, and John 16:33.

questions.question: What does Paul describe believers as being unto God in 2 Corinthians 2:15?
questions.correctAnswer: A sweet savour of Christ
questions.explanation: Believers are described as a sweet fragrance representing Christ to both the saved and the lost, echoing Leviticus 1:9, Ephesians 5:2, 2 Corinthians 2:16, and Philippians 4:18.

questions.question: How does Paul differentiate the effect of believers as a sweet savour on those who perish versus those who are saved?
options: Savour of death unto death for the perishing; savour of life unto life for the saved
Savour of bitterness for the perishing; savour of sweetness for the saved
Savour of judgment for the perishing; savour of mercy for the saved
Savour of weakness for the perishing; savour of strength for the saved
questions.correctAnswer: Savour of death unto death for the perishing; savour of life unto life for the saved
questions.explanation: Verse 16 contrasts the gospel’s reception—death for unbelievers, life for believers—consistent with John 3:36, Romans 6:23, Ezekiel 18:4, and Revelation 20:15.

questions.question: What question does Paul ask at the end of 2 Corinthians 2:16, highlighting the weight of the ministry?
options: Who is sufficient for these things?
questions.correctAnswer: Who is sufficient for these things?
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges the heavy responsibility of ministry (2 Corinthians 2:16), resonating with 1 Corinthians 1:26-29, 2 Corinthians 12:9-10, Jeremiah 1:6-8, and Exodus 3:11.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:17, how does Paul describe his speaking compared to others who corrupt the word of God?
options: As of sincerity, as of God, speaking in Christ's sight
questions.correctAnswer: As of sincerity, as of God, speaking in Christ's sight
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts his authentic ministry with those who distort scripture, emphasizing integrity and divine accountability, consistent with Acts 20:27, 1 Timothy 4:16, Galatians 1:6-9, and 2 Timothy 2:15.

questions.question: What kind of punishment does Paul say is sufficient for the man who caused grief among the Corinthians?
questions.correctAnswer: The punishment inflicted by many
questions.explanation: Verse 6 indicates that communal discipline served as adequate correction, aligning with principles in Matthew 18:17, 1 Corinthians 5:5, Hebrews 12:11, and Galatians 6:1.

questions.question: What is Paul’s purpose in writing to the Corinthians according to 2 Corinthians 2:9?
options: To know the proof of their obedience in all things
questions.correctAnswer: To know the proof of their obedience in all things
questions.explanation: Paul writes to test their obedience (2 Corinthians 2:9), reflecting biblical themes of testing and proving faith (James 1:3, Romans 12:1, 1 Corinthians 11:28, and Hebrews 3:8).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 2:5, when a person causes grief, who is primarily grieved?
options: Paul, but only in part, so as not to overcharge the whole church
questions.correctAnswer: Paul, but only in part, so as not to overcharge the whole church
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges personal grief but limits the burden on the church (2 Corinthians 2:5), consistent with pastoral care principles in 1 Thessalonians 2:7, Galatians 6:2, Acts 20:28, and 1 Peter 5:2-3.
